summary: William G. Miller is mentioned in several documents related to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC). He appears in a memorandum listing staff personnel with security clearances up to TOP SECRET, indicating his involvement in sensitive intelligence matters. He is also present in transcripts of Senate Select Committee hearings discussing CIA activities, including the use of media and academics, and restrictions on operational activities. Additionally, he is mentioned in documents related to Project ZRRIFLE and liaison contacts between CIA's JMWAVE station and local police organizations in Miami. Finally, he is mentioned in a document concerning Martin Luther King, Jr., and Stanley Levison's alleged ties to the Communist Party USA (CPUSA).
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
significance: Based on the documents provided, William G. Miller's significance in the JFK context is not explicitly stated. However, his presence in documents related to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) suggests he may have been involved in investigations or oversight related to intelligence matters, some of which could potentially touch on aspects relevant to the JFK assassination. The documents do not provide enough information to determine the extent of his involvement or his direct connection to the JFK assassination.
